Configuring webAppOS google_scopes.webservice

by Sergejs Kozlovics, Raimonds Makars

version 2020-08-27z

This document explains how to obtain Google IDs and keys to enable Google authentication and access to Google drive from webAppOS.

The official Google documentation can be found here: https://developers.google.com/adwords/api/docs/guides/authentication#webapp

However, it will be still difficult to configure your Google cloud account. Thus, we will explain the process to you step-by-step.

Configuring Google Authentication

First, open  Google API Console Credentials page (login with your Google account, if asked).

On top of the page you will see the Google APIs logo. On the right of it, choose your project name (if you have no projects, create one).

In the menu on the left, choose “OAuth consent screen” (if you haven't configured it yet):

  • When asked, choose “External”
  • Fill in the project name that will be displayed to your end users when logging-in.
  • Choose an icon (optionally).
  • Keep the domains and links empty
  • Click Save.

After configuring the OAuth consent screen, you can switch to configuring the credentials (choose “Credentials” in the left menu):

Click the “CREATE CREDENTIALS” button, then choose “Create OAuth client id”.

  • In the “Application type” box, choose “Web application”. 
  • Write the name of your application. This name is used only to identify the client in the Google console.
  • Add one or more HTTP or HTTPS origins that host your application. For the default local setup, enter “http://localhost:4570”.
  • Add a redirect URL. It is a path, where the user will be redirected after they have been authenticated by Google.

  • Click the “CREATE” button

Now, you see the credentials window, where you can find Your Client ID and Your Client Secret.

You will need to copy and paste these values into the file “webAppOS\dist\apps\google_scopes.webservice”:

oauth_client_id=<Your Client ID>

drive_client_id=<Your Client ID>

drive_client_secret=<Your Client Secret>

Enabling Google Drive API

If you wish to be able to access Google drive, you have to enable Google Drive API. Go to

https://console.developers.google.com/apis/library/drive.googleapis.com, and enable Google Drive API for your project (this API is a part of Google API Library).
